meanings.definition: An area of low-lying land that is flooded in wet seasons and remains waterlogged at all times.
meanings.sent1: The ducks waddled through the marshland, searching for insects.
meanings.sent2: The marshland was home to many different types of birds and plants.
meanings.sent3: The frogs in the marshland held a singing competition every night.
meanings.sent4: The marshland was a vast sponge, soaking up the rain like a thirsty traveler.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the marshland lingered in the air, a mix of earth and water.

meanings.definition: Land consisting of marshes or swamps.
meanings.sent1: The explorers carefully navigated the marshland, wary of hidden dangers.
meanings.sent2: The marshland was teeming with life, from tiny insects to large alligators.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the marshland was a magical kingdom, full of mystery and adventure.
meanings.sent4: The marshland stretched out like a green carpet, inviting all who dared to explore.
meanings.sent5: The sun set over the marshland, painting the sky in shades of pink and orange.
